At each of the twelve earthly branches’ positions, dig the earth to form a platform, leveling its surface so that its center aligns with the central point. First, at the hour of *yin* during the Spring Equinox, take a mortar of five *yin* and prepare a bath of orchid and mugwort infusion. By the fifth *mao* day, draw water to brew chrysanthemum nectar at the *yin* and *mao* positions. On the following day, select the fourteen *zhangju*. At the time of selection, clear the surroundings, arrange small mats as seats, and prepare fourteen designated places. Burn incense, offer each wine and dried meat, bow twice, and recite the incantation:

*"Born of the* zhangju*, body upright and pure, guarding the twelve palaces, your qi communes with spirits. Today, I unite with you, joining in divine fellowship. I take you as friend, to wander together at the southern slope of such-and-such a mountain. When I call, you shall answer; when I ask, you shall respond. Let no deceit breach our pact; let our bond be sealed in covenant."*

After three libations of wine, conclude the offering. Grasp the root, carve it into human form, and assign names according to their completion, distinguishing male from female. The next dawn, when the day aligns with the Eastern Well constellation, kneel at the door and declare: *"Your humble descendant So-and-so, having completed the bath today, enters the chamber to install the* zhangju." *Wait until the day of the Five Designations, then take their brushes and inscribe talismans on the corresponding days, placing them among the Five Talismans. After ten days, all will be complete; then burn incense. On the appointed day, offer sacrifices to the* zhangju *at their earthly branch positions. First, call them by their names and recite the incantation: "So-and-so, who communes with spirits, today shares your name. After twelve branches and six cycles of ten, you shall respond to mortals on the twelfth day."*

After the offering, simply burn incense, visualize the Eight Scribes, memorize their names, and gather white blossoms. Dry and process them, then ingest a square-inch spoonful within the hall to commune with the body’s spirits and befriend the Scribes. Thereafter, on days when the heavens align with the Eastern Well, dissolve the talismans, bathe again, and replace them. Repeat this process every other day as prescribed. After five baths, completing one hundred twenty-four days, the spirits will all have arrived—some may already be heard, others seen, appearing as depicted in the illustrations. The next dawn, offer sacrifices beneath the hall’s central pillar, and the spirits will converse with you. The Six Jia Jade Maidens with azure sashes and attendant wings will also arrive, though they do not speak to mortals. Thus, the Eight Scribes attend first, and you, understanding human affairs, should inquire of them the Way of divine transcendence and longevity. The Scribes enter the celestial lodgings to review the registers and relay the words to mortals. If your name is not recorded in the Register of Immortals, you remain distant from transcendence. You may only cultivate devotion to attain wealth and nobility, extending your lifespan to three or four hundred years. Merely ingesting divine elixirs, golden liquors, or mineral medicines diverges from the Dao.

If you seek longevity, command the Eight Scribes to perform transformations and summon traveling kitchens with myriad offerings, you must dissolve and place the Designation Talismans in a five-colored pouch, hanging it within the canopy of your bed. Take a vermilion brush to inscribe white silk with the Eight Trigrams’ Mystic Cavern Communion Talisman of the Eight Mighty Spirits, placing it over your heart to command them. Regularly employ the Five Talismans and *zhangju* to summon the Eight Scribes, ensuring they do not depart. The Eight Talismans govern their might and control, compelling them to remain, though they cannot fully preserve or stabilize them. Collect the *zhangju* figures, each in a leather pouch. Craft a bamboo basket shaped like a pot to hold the twelve figures, covering it inside and out with leather. Name it the Harmonious Hare’s Secret Chamber of Spirit Communion and place it within your bed’s canopy. Each dawn, bow twice and recite the incantation:

*"Spirit So-and-so, ever communing with your humble descendant, I beseech you today to accompany Scribe So-and-so, riding together upon the Azure Dragon, traversing the hidden realms. Whatever is spoken today, let the two attendants at the door hear and heed, pursuing and installing the spirit at the designated door. When venturing forth, call the spirit of the current door, barring the Five Evil Specters from entering the Jade Chamber. Instead, usher in the luminous Jade Maidens of the Dao of divine transcendence, the Six Jia spirits, and all deities present today within my garments. Visualize the talisman and summon the Scribe to depart; the Scribe follows wherever you rest. If you wish to conceal your form or transform your body, visualize the Scribe at your left elbow, and you shall move unseen among crowds. To manifest auspicious omens or wondrous marvels, command the Scribe aloud to perform your bidding, leaving traces where you pause. People will speak and sounds will resonate as the Scribe enacts transformations—nothing is beyond their power."*

Once this Way is accomplished, you may conceal and record all things, face and perceive ghosts and spirits, sit and behold the Eight Wastes, cause the sun and moon to alternate between darkness and light, disrupt the five colors’ order of blue and yellow, alter the stars’ paths and celestial measures, make the Five Peaks shift and turn at will, and invert the four seasons’ yin and yang. In winter, grass and trees grow; in summer, frost and ice form. You may command thunder and lightning to crash and roar, clouds and mist to surge and soar. When blessings sweep in, banish misfortune and calamity. If you cultivate this, you shall be enthroned as a Transcendent King. Once transformations are mastered, all things become accessible—you may save the living, prolong the short-lived, deliver and protect boundless beings.

Do not lightly scorn the world’s people or recklessly act against the Dao, lest the populace tremble in fear and pray to celestial spirits, who will hold you accountable. The Dao will then recede far from you—beware. If you employ the Scribes for three years without offending the spirits, even without a name in the Register of Immortals, the Scribes will petition on your behalf to extend your years to a thousand.

On a *wu* or *ji* day of flourishing *wangxiang*, take four thousand gold coins to the central land or to a blessed and virtuous place in the city, and burn the mat-incense to completion. In total, twenty-four thousand gold coins are to be used, all personally prepared in purification. When burning the incense, one must not seek to harmonize the Five Tones.

On a day when the celestial lodges align with Dongjing, bathe in orchid-infused water to purify the body, observe the fast, and enter the chamber to burn incense. Begin with the eastern direction, and complete the ritual in twenty-four days. When the celestial qi is received in harmony, transmit the Five Tones.

If one begrudges wealth and arbitrarily reduces the offering, failing to align with the celestial qi, or if one transmits the scripture without proper authorization, the celestial qi will fall into disharmony, the Five Stars will not shine, the Five Thearchs will not bestow their talismans, the Five Marchmounts will not open, the Five Viscera will suffer illness, and calamity will bring about the destruction of the body.

The Immortal Duke said: "Many Daoist masters in villages and counties are poor. Now, gold and bronze coins may be used as substitutes to transmit the scriptures. Disciples must personally prepare the required offerings with reverence, observing the fast and aiding the destitute; they must not use them for private purposes. Burn the Fivefold Blended Incense to demonstrate utmost sincerity."

Lord Lao said: "The *Lingbao* is the foremost of the Dao, upon which divine spirits constantly rely, and which all the sages of the heavens, earth, and realms universally revere. The Mystic Cavern’s numinous spirit-true talismans, the Three Sovereigns’ celestial writings in great script, and the root texts of the *Dongzhen* scriptures are equal to the *Lingbao*. Thus, they were first compiled into the Five-Named Talismans, while the rest were incorporated into the celestial qi, hence called the Celestial Script and the Sovereign’s Talismans. Together, they may be employed to summon and command the spirits of heaven and earth. One must first wear the *Lingbao* talisman before deploying the script, for only then can the spirits be attained. Once the spirits are attained and one relies on oneself, they will not bring misfortune to others.

Without the *Lingbao* scriptures, how can one cultivate celestial perfected beings? Be cautious in their application: if one summons spirits without consistently relying on oneself, it will instead bring misfortune to others, harming oneself and one’s descendants. Having obtained the *Lingbao* talismans, one should also acquire the *Lingbao* Charts. The Charts comprise twenty-four sections, embodying the true qi of heaven—my dharma titles, the true methods of the Great Dao.

If you seek the methods of the Dao, first bathe to remove filth and impurities, and obtain the *Dongjing Chart*. If you wish to stabilize the Five Thearchs and command mountain spirits, obtain the *Five Marchmounts Chart*. If you seek to communicate with divine spirits, first resolve the Eight Essences, and obtain the *Eight Scribes’ True Forms Chart*. If you wish to master the Five Phases and summon the traveling kitchen, obtain the *Six Jia Spirit-Communication Chart*. If you wish to preserve the Five Teeth and summon celestial spirits, obtain the *Nine Palaces Purple Chamber Chart*. If you wish to uphold the methods of the Dao, obtain the *Taiqing Chart*. If you wish to follow the Dao in compliance, obtain the *Hunchen Chart*. If you seek to grasp the mechanisms of the Dao, obtain the *Xisheng Baolu Chart*. If you wish to master the transformations of the Dao, obtain the *Linghua Chart*. If you wish to tread the celestial Dao, obtain the *Nine Heavens Chart*. If you wish to liberate your bodily form, obtain the *Nine Transformations Chart*. If you wish to conceal and preserve the spirits guarding your body, obtain the *Changcun Chart*. If you wish to stabilize your body and guard the divine treasure, obtain the *Hanying Chart*. If you wish to cultivate tranquility and guard the One to preserve your body, obtain the *Yangshen Chart*. If you wish to nurture your will in silence, obtain the *Jingcheng Shouzhi Chart*. If you wish to attain purity and whiteness to summon the mushroom spirits, obtain the *Zhiying Yunu Chart*. If you wish to summon the Six Ding, obtain the *Six Yin Jade Maidens Chart*. If you seek immortal records, obtain the *Nine-Nine Daoist Immortal Chart*. If you wish to ingest the qi of the Dao, obtain the *Daoyin Chart*. If you wish to practice the arts of the Dao, obtain the *Dongzhong Hongbao Chart*. If you wish to master transformations, obtain the *Yince Chart*. If you wish to refine the furnace and stabilize the Nine Elixirs and Golden Liquor, obtain the *Taiyi Chart*. If you wish to ascend the Five Marchmounts to seek divine mushroom medicines, obtain the *Kaishan Zhiyao Chart*. If you wish to protect your bodily form and repel malevolent spirits, demons, and specters, obtain the *Mingjing Chart*. Once you have obtained the *Mingjing Chart*, you should also acquire the *Hanjing Chart*.

In total, there are twenty-four true charts—my *Lingbao*. The *Dongzhong Huanglu* chapters, the *Zhonghuang Jiudu* scriptures, and their respective esoteric essential texts are all my alternate titles. All take the *Lingbao* natural talismans as their fundamental origin, mutually complementing one another to become a perfected person. If you can obtain them, you will surely attain longevity, ascending as a transcendent, soaring through the Great Clarity, where eons pass like a single day."

The Yellow Thearch said: "The Celestial Elder, seeing that my humble omens did not yet comprehend the celestial qi, bestowed upon me the *Lingbao Five-Named Talisman Scripture*. I request that, following the *Dongjing* prophecies, on an auspicious day of purity, one should bathe in purification and observe the fast to receive the *Lingbao* talismans.

The proper times are:
- The tenth day of the first month at the *ren ding* hour,
- The eighth day of the second month at the *huang hun* hour,
- The sixth day of the third month at the *ri ru* hour,
- The fourth day of the fourth month at the *xia bu* hour,
- The first day of the fifth month at the *shang bu* hour, and the twenty-ninth day at the *ri bu* hour,
- The twenty-seventh day of the sixth month at the *ri zhong* hour,
- The twenty-fifth day of the seventh month at the *yu zhong* hour,
- The twenty-second day of the eighth month at the *ri chu* hour,
- The twentieth day of the ninth month at the *ji san ming* hour,
- The eighteenth day of the tenth month at the *ji chu ming* hour,
- The fifteenth day of the eleventh month at the *guo ye ban* hour,
- The thirteenth day of the twelfth month at the *ye ban* hour.

These are all times when the celestial qi and the lunar lodge align with Dongjing. On these days and hours, one should blend incense in harmony with the divine immortals, bathe, and the spirits will descend into oneself. Bathing in orchid-infused water signifies that the Daoist seeks communion with divine beings—ordinary people do not require this ritual.

Furthermore, the superior method involves placing the Five Stones to pacify the household, as stated in the *Kaiming Scripture*: 'A household possessing the *Lingbao* will never age for ten thousand years. A lord possessing the Five-Named and Eight Might talismans will ensure that all treasures remain undiminished.' Thus, no further pacification is needed."

The Supreme Great Ultimate Perfected One said: After receiving this scripture, a Dao practitioner transmits it to one person every forty years. Those who have extended their lifespan transmit it to one person every four hundred years. Those who attain earthly immortality transmit it to one person every four thousand years. Those who attain celestial immortality transmit it to one person every forty thousand years. Those who attain the supreme, profoundly quiescent, Most High Perfected One transmit it to one person every forty thousand kalpas. The transmission protocols of the Supreme Numinous Treasure Great Method are thus complete.

This scripture expounds the Way of the lofty immortals who traverse the void. The Supreme’s vast and universal teachings are set forth; its profound and distant words are manifest. The mystery of the true and the subtle essence of the imperceptible cannot be contemplated or discussed.

The Immortal Duke said: Thus, through the ages, all worthies have sung odes of transcendent thought.

The Supreme Mysterious Unity Perfected One said: The *Five Thousand Character Scripture* is the most profound of texts, fully conveying the intent of the Dao and the teachings of true correctness. This is the lineage of the loftiest immortals, and it can also bring blessings to the seven generations of ancestors.

The Immortal Duke said: The *Five Thousand Character Scripture* is magnificent, its marvels and profundities defying description. If a practitioner’s heart is not wholly consumed by thoughts of glory and splendor but remains inwardly and outwardly steadfast, reading this scripture in hope of attaining celestial perfection, such a goal remains unseen. According to the scriptures and precepts, the supreme Way is difficult to achieve. One must initiate even the smallest effort, cultivating diligently, like a traveler on a thousand-mile journey taking the first step. Only through accumulating goodness over countless kalpas can one naturally attain union with it.

*Scripture of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao’s Natural True Unity and the Five-Named Talismans, Lower Scroll* concludes.
